newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes down slightly against US dollar.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes down slightly against US dollar.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed down slightly at 8.2967 against the U.S. dollar on Thursday from Wednesday's 8.2966 on a technical correction, but pro-yuan sentiment remained strong, traders said.
The yuan opened unchanged at 8.2966 and moved steadily above 8.2970 for most of the session, hitting an intra-day high of 8.2963 and a low of 8.2973.
Trading was slow, with most done at 8.2967, traders said.
"The sudden rises on Wednesday promoted more bids at lower levels," one dealer said.
"The trend indicated growing demand for the local unit ahead of the Spring Festival which gives the yuan more room for rises," he added.
A second dealer agreed, saying the yuan would remain strong in the near future.
He said that while the yuan's rise would be slow due to fear of central bank intervention, its upwards movement would not change in the short term.
Dealers expect the yuan to move in the range of 8.2960 and 8.2970 on Friday.
The yuan closed up at 7.1410 from 7.2000 against 100 Japanese yen and down slightly at 1.0734 from 1.0730 against the Hong Kong dollar.
